results.title: Robert Frost's The death of the hired man
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Jeanne Collachla
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Robert Frost’s narrative poem of the same title about an aged and no longer productive hired man, who returns to live on a couple’s farm. The film captures the couple’s apprehension over the fate of the proud, homeless man amid scenes depciting early 20th century farm life in New England.

results.title: Robert D. Fitzgerald
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Videos on Australian Writers: archival writers series II”.
Acclaimed poet Robert D. Fitzgerald describes himself as a “professional surveyor and an amateur poet”. He recalls his experiences working for the Native Lands Commission in the remote interior regions of Fiji which inspired his poem “Between two tides”. Fitzgerald remembers his friendship with fellow writers Kenneth Slessor, Jack and Phillip Lindsay, Douglas Stewart and Dame Mary Gilmore. During the Vietnam war, Fitzgerald was active in the anti-war movement. He discusses the reasons for his involvement and recalls the events surrounding the Arts Vietnam protest.

results.title: Robert Browning: his life and poetry
results.brief_description: Surveys the biography and works of the Victorian poet Robert Browning, focussing on the revelation of dramatic monologue. The film shows the things from which Browning drew his inspiration and uses paintings, early photographs and scenes of unchanged parts of London and Italy to illustrate the events of his life. Selections of his poetry are read by constumed actors, emphasising the drama and psychological insight of his work. Narrated by Andrew Faulds.

results.title: Robert Boynes
results.creator_credit: Ken Otton, Robert Lindsay, Lloyd Carrick and Alan Cole
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Robert Boynes is often grouped with a number of Australian artists who, working from the mid 1960’s, are referred to as “Australian Pop” artists. Australian pop has its own distinct flavour, different from the U.S. and U.K. schools, and related to the Australian environment

results.title: Robert's story [Subtitled]
results.creator_credit: Robert Weston, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
A trip down memory lane for Robert Weston as he reminisces about family, his childhood, fishing and hunting, and living on the land in the bush.
In English language with English subtitles.

results.title: Robert
results.creator_credit: Cedric Smith, Wolf Koenig, Signe Johansson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
Robert tells of the identity crisis of a fifteen-year-old whose father walked out years earlier. Already overwhelmed by problems at school, despair at the situation of the world, and his awkwardness with girls, Robert suddenly discovers that his mother has a serious boyfriend. One of a series of six short dramatic discussion starters for adolescents and adults on the subject of teenage alienation.

results.title: Robbie the reindeer in hooves of fire
results.brief_description: Robbie the Reindeer has a big set of hoofprints to follow in - his father is Santa’s beloved Rudolph (he of red-nosed fame). Robbie has come to the North Pole to take his place on Santa’s team but he is a young reindeer who lacks direction and soon realises that he is not fit or disciplined enough to keep up with the others. He must firstly prove himself in the annual Reindeer races to win the respect of his teammates and the love of a girl. In the spirit of animator Nick Park’s ‘Wallace and Gromit’ series and written by some of Britain’s top comics, this is an animated adventure the whole family will enjoy. Voices include those of Robbie Williams, Jane Horrocks, Rhys Ifans, Ricky Tomlinson, Harry Enfield and Ardal O’Hanlon. Music by Mark Knopfler.
